attributes.name: role
attributes.description: The role attribute must be set to the value button. It is used to identify the element as a command button the the browser. This is especially needed for anchor elements that are turned into buttons.

attributes.name: data-zui-button-loader-timeout
attributes.description: The timeout in milliseconds before the loader icon is shown. Default is 1000.

classes.name: zui-button
classes.description: The zui-button class turns a non-button element into a button. This class should be used on anchors.

classes.name: zui-button-dropdown
classes.description: The zui-button-dropdown class turns a button into a button with a dropdown menu.

classes.name: zui-button-link
classes.description: The zui-button-link class turns a button into a link. This is useful for tertiary buttons such as cancel links.

classes.name: zui-button-loader
classes.description: The zui-button-loader class adds a loader icon next to the button to indicate that a background task is running.

classes.name: zui-button-primary
classes.description: The zui-button-primary class turns a button into a primary button. A primary button is the button that is the most important button.

classes.name: zui-button-split-main
classes.description: The zui-button-split-main class identifies the left part of a split button. It should always be used in combination with the zui-button-split-more class.

classes.name: zui-button-split-more
classes.description: The zui-button-split-more class identifies the button that will show the dropdown menu. It should always be used in combination with the zui-button-split-main class.

classes.name: zui-button-subtle
classes.description: The zui-button-subtle class turns a button into a subtle button. It looks like a link but when you hover the button it looks like a normal button. Subtle buttons should always be used in combination with icons.
